intro: Ionopsidium prolongoi var. heterospermum, commonly known as the variable seed ionopsidium, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its unique morphological features, including elongated leaves and distinctive floral structures. The plant exhibits a varietal form that shows variation in seed morphology, which is a key botanical feature. It typically grows in humid, shaded environments and requires well-drained, nutrient-rich soil. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
